intro: Disperis oxyglossa, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid environments. It is known for its unique morphology, with leaves that are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Disperis oxyglossa is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
